controller package

Module contents

class controller.Controller(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

Singleton class responsible for controlling game interactions.

__new__(cls, *args, **kwargs)

Creates and returns an instance of the Controller class.

__init__(self, user_name

str): Initializes an instance of the Controller class with a user name.

get_direction(self)

Returns directions from the current location.

get_current_location(self)

Returns the name of the current location.

get_description_current_location(self)

Returns the description of the current location.

go_line_script(self, line_id

int): Moves to the next line of the script.

get_health_protogonist(self)

Shows the current health of the protagonist.

get_exp_protogonist(self)

Shows the current experience points of the protagonist.

get_health_enemy(self)

Shows the current health of the enemy.

get_attributes(self)

Returns a list of player attributes, or None if empty.

can_move_next_location(self, direction)

Checks if the player can move to the next location.

go(self, direction)

Moves the main character in the specified direction.

can_move_next_location(direction)

Checks if the player can move to the next location.

Parameters:

direction – Movement direction.

Returns:

True - if the player can move, False - movement is restricted.

Return type:

bool

Returns a list of player attributes.

Returns:

list of player attributes.

Return type:

List

Name of the current location.

Return type:

str

Returns:

Description of the current location.

get_direction()

Returns directions from the current location.

Returns:

List of current directions.

Shows the current experience points of the protagonist.

Returns:

Return type:

int

Shows the current health of the enemy.

Returns:

Return type:

int

get_health_protogonist()

Shows the current health of the protagonist.

Returns:

Health points of the protagonist.

Return type:

int

go(direction)

Moves the main character in the specified direction.

Parameters:

direction – Movement direction.

Returns:

similar to the go_line_script function.

Return type:

Dict

go_line_script(line_id)

Moves to the next line of the script.

Parameters:

line_id (int) – Identifier of the script line.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary if the script line continues,

or None if the end of the dialogues in the current location.

Return type:

Dict or None

use_attributes()

Uses player attributes.

Calls the method for using attributes of the main character through the facade.
